entries.meaning: (Scotland) A large draught of any liquid.
examples: “Bring twa,” here interrupted Johnny Yuill, in a loud voice; “for I′m dooms dry, and ′ll sen′ owre a bottle to my ain share at a waucht, and I′m sure ye′ll manage the ither yersel, Provost; and, if ye canna, I′ll help ye wi′ that, too.”

verbs.description: waucht (third-person singular simple present wauchts, present participle wauchting, simple past and past participle wauchted)

examples: Eftir this the Erles and thair kin passis to the Tolbuith, with the haill ministerie: all ar maid burgessis of this toun; the ministers with the rest. At euin[even], nathing bot wauchting.
